name: (2Z)-[(4-chlorophenyl)hydrazono][4-(4-methylphenyl)-1,3-thiazol-2-yl]ethanenitrile
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-1043
Reason: 1,3-Thiazole ring: The 1,3-thiazole ring introduces a rigid structure with potential hydrogen bonding, estimated at around +20°C. The chlorine atom introduces a strong withdrawing group, increasing intermolecular forces and melting point by approximately +50°C. The phenyl group and methyl group introduce additional rigid structures, estimated at around +10°C each. The hydrazono group introduces additional rigid structures, estimated at around +10°C. The chlorine atom introduces additional rigid structures, estimated at around +5°C.
